headline: Realtor.com®: As Market Cools, Buyer Regret Does Too
summary: One of the most common sources of post-purchase remorse – feeling they paid too much for their home – has dropped dramatically among U.S. homebuyers, falling from 15% in 2023 to just 8% in 2025, according to research from Realtor.com®. The decline highlights how buyers are entering purchases more deliberately in today's slower, higher-rate housing market, and reaping the benefits of more confident decision-making.
